ICYMI: I spoke about the budget deficit with @hereandnow this afternoon... Check out my interview here: https://t.co/c4kQ55PC1v @WBUR

I hope GOP leadership is serious about passing a balanced budget amendment, and they work hard to whip votes for this measure. This amendment has a steep vote count. If for some reason it fails, we can always try other fiscal moves with less austere requirements.
The deficit is expected to rise to as high as $1 trillion in 2019. Right now, even with our mountainous $21 trillion in debt, we are not even headed in the direction of a balanced budget.

In the first six months of the fiscal year, revenues increased by $26 billion. On the other hand, spending increased by $97 billion in that same amount of time resulting in an almost $600 billion deficit.
The economy is growing and our revenue is increasing, but our spending is growing at four times the rate of revenue.
Along with a balanced budget amendment, Congress should pass a spending limit amendment bill. Here's why...
And it would decrease the likelihood that Congress will continue on its current path of bankrupting the United States and shackling our kids with our an unpaid credit card bill.
It would restore the balance of power away from the executive branch back to the legislative branch.
It would codify Congress’s responsibility for fiscal responsibility.
I am supportive of efforts to pass a #BalancedBudgetAmendment for several reasons...

.@RushLimbaugh has more on what the president should do from his radio program today: https://t.co/zqxoIKgIZa
Why in the world would we give up our own power unilaterally? It makes absolutely no sense.
The president should request a budget that will include reconciliation so we only need 51 votes like we did with tax reform… that way the Democrats can’t hold us hostage.

Because of provisions in the February budget, the Senate doesn’t even need to vote on a budget this year. That is not acceptable. The president should demand a change. And believe me this this was intentional to avoid hard work in the Senate.
More, the president and the GOP promised a wall. No fences. A wall. Border wall funding is a priority.
Congress should comply with the president’s request to defund these rebel cities – they need to do this through a budget.
There are large swaths of the American homeland that are in open defiance of federal law. These so-called ‘sanctuary cities’ should be re-named ‘secession cities.’
Tax reform was a great accomplishment, but we have many more promises to keep. The only way we can do that is through a budget with reconciliation. @IngrahamAngle @rushlimbaugh
